intro: Crataegus tracyi var. madrensis, commonly known as the Madreño hawthorn, is a shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny branches and clusters of white to pink flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but often tart. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the Crataegus genus.
